subject: Re: Re: Re: How to write a Mock Class for a 3rd party class where the contructor are private
msgSnippet: ... OK.  You don t have to help me :) ... If not, I d like to understand the question more, so we can hopefully come to more of a convergence. Thanks, Chad
messageBody:
Steve Freeman wrote:

> This may be the source of our divergence. I'm not sure how much I can help if this is an issue.

OK. You don't have to help me :)

However, I'd like to know if I came close to answering your original question:

>> My one caveat is that this makes mocking a testing technique, so it's
>> good for working with external libraries. How do you get the (asserted)
>> benefits of mocks as a design technique for new code?

If not, I'd like to understand the question more, so we can hopefully come to
more of a convergence.

Thanks,
Chad
